Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Autograph \Au"to*graph\, n. [F. autographe, fr. Gr. ? autographic; ? self + ? to write.] That which is written with one's own hand; an original manuscript; a person's own signature or handwriting. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Autograph \Au"to*graph\, a. In one's own handwriting; as, an autograph letter; an autograph will. [1913 Webster]
autograph n 1: something written by one's own hand 2: a person's own signature [syn: {John Hancock}] v : mark with one's signature; "The author autographed his book" [syn: {inscribe}]
